metadata.name: 300 BC
metadata.description:
Photo by Emre Ceylan
Year : 2021
Edition 1/1
Location : Ancient city of Blaundus / Western Anatolia, UÅŸak Province
Built by Macedonians at around 300 BC 

Astro Photography is a jewel on my Timescapes Collection. Specially Panoramas. 

Since I was a child, I lay on grass at night watching sky, thinking of the vastness of space and mesmerize by its beauty. 

On a clear summer night with a visible milky way, you are looking at your own galaxy and galactic center ( the brightest part of the milky way ) is 27.000 light years away from you.  

That means the light reaching your eye started it's journey in the stone age. A mind boggling concept of space and time spin my head around and make me question my existence at the same time. 

Now you can imagine how I feel when I work on this project. 

You can find the story  behind this photograph on my youtube channel.
